intro: Pedicularis tsaii, commonly known as the Tsai's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often resembling those of orchids. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a short, hairy stem with opposite leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
